snippet: The players union agreed with Alex Rodriguez’s decision to appeal the 211-game suspension levied against him on Monday.
abstract: Michael Weiner, chief of baseball players union, discloses that association had urged Alex Rodriguez to accept suspension from Major League Baseball, but that it decided to eventually support Rodrguez's appeal because 221 game penalty was excessive.
lead_paragraph: The players union agreed with Alex Rodriguez’s decision to appeal the 211-game suspension levied against him on Monday.

headline.main: Length of Rodriguez’s Suspension Was Sticking Point
headline.print_headline: Length of Rodriguez’s Suspension Was Sticking Point
